intro: Rosa × subcanina subsp. klasterskii, commonly known as the Klasterskii rose, is a hybrid species within the genus Rosa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces fragrant, semi-double to double pink flowers. The plant typically has thorny stems and heart-shaped, serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for garden cultivation. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental qualities and historical significance in horticultural breeding.
